alert.note: Alert for Allegan; Ottawa; Van Buren (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 11 at 8:49PM EDT until August 12 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...High wave action, strong currents, and dangerous swimming conditions expected. Piers may be heavily swamped by waves. * WHERE...Ottawa, Allegan and Van Buren counties. * WHEN...Until 6 AM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Strong currents can pull swimmers into deeper water and high waves can sweep people off piers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The crest of the highest waves continues to move south. The crest pasted the Holland around 6 pm this evening and South Haven around 720 pm. The significant wave heights have reached 5.2 feet at South Haven with the maximum wave height of 8 feet at 720 pm this evening. The wind and waves will slowly subside over the next few hours.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions and do not venture out on piers. Please check with your local authorities on potential beach closures.
